content:
• Wednesday, October 10, 2012
  • RT

    More on Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): Shares slide after hours as FQ1 earnings miss the mark. Net...

    More on Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): Shares slide after hours as FQ1 earnings miss the mark. Net profit fell 16% Y/Y as the casual-dining chain was hit by higher than anticipated chief executive-search costs, masking higher total revenue and its first same-store sales increase in nearly two years. Operating margin also rose on cost-saving efforts to 19.7% from 15.7%. Shares -7.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • DRWI

    More on DragonWave's FQ2: Chairman Gerry Spencer is stepping down, citing "family reasons," and...

    More on DragonWave's FQ2: Chairman Gerry Spencer is stepping down, citing "family reasons," and will be replaced by director Claude Haw. DragonWave expects FQ3 revenue of $43M-$50M, in-line with a $48.7M consensus. Thanks to the acquisition of Nokia Siemens' wireless backhaul business (closed on June 1), FQ2 gross margin was 21% (excluding an inventory charge), down from 32% in FQ1 and 42% in the year-ago period. CC at 8:30AM ET tomorrow (webcast). DRWI +5.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • RGLD

    Royal Gold (NASDAQ:RGLD) -3.4% AH after announcing an offering of 5.25M common shares. RGLD...

    Royal Gold (NASDAQ:RGLD) -3.4% AH after announcing an offering of 5.25M common shares. RGLD intends to use the net proceeds for the acquisition of additional royalty or similar interests and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • SCMR

    Sycamore Networks (NASDAQ:SCMR): FQ4 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $16.8M (+29% Y/Y)...

    Sycamore Networks (NASDAQ:SCMR): FQ4 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $16.8M (+29% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI): Q2 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $44.2M (+225% Y/Y) beats...

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI): Q2 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $44.2M (+225% Y/Y) beats by $3.2M. Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • VOXX

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): Q2 EPS of $0.16 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $191.7M (+21.1%...

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): Q2 EPS of $0.16 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $191.7M (+21.1% Y/Y) misses by $13M. Shares -10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • RT

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): FQ1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $332.9M (+1% Y/Y) in-line....

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT): FQ1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $332.9M (+1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • SKYW

    SkyWest (SKYW -6.1%) is downgraded to Underperform by BAML on valuation concerns after shares...

    SkyWest (SKYW -6.1%) is downgraded to Underperform by BAML on valuation concerns after shares have climbed ~60% in past three months and now trade at a substantial premium to the major U.S. airlines; yet the firm says SKYW lacks the upside earnings leverage of its partner airlines. SKYW reported September revenue passenger miles rose 1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +14.8%) pops after announcing Phase I clinical results indicating...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (INO +14.8%) pops after announcing Phase I clinical results indicating that its DNA-based synthetic vaccine VGX-3100 is not only capable of boosting immune responses to antigens from high risk types of human papillomavirus infection, but also killing cells changed by the virus into precancerous dysplasias.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • CVX

    Chevron (CVX -4.1%) shares sink after the company warned of disappointing Q3 earnings, but...

    Chevron (CVX -4.1%) shares sink after the company warned of disappointing Q3 earnings, but several analysts say CVX's long-term strengths will fuel a higher stock price. It's worth noting that much of the weak update comes from one-time issues, including the hurricane, refinery fire and planned maintenance that pressured production.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • RDC

    Rowan (RDC -1.6%) and Diamond Offshore (DO -1.7%) are downgraded to Market Perform at...

    Rowan (RDC -1.6%) and Diamond Offshore (DO -1.7%) are downgraded to Market Perform at FBR Capital, which says it is growing more selective among offshore drillers as the likelihood of sticker shock from deepwater contract news is lower, and offshore drillers could ultimately attract investors looking to increase exposure to U.S. land services once they gain more clarity.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • DAR

    Darling International (DAR -5.4%) is downgraded to Market Perform at BMO Capital Markets, which...

    Darling International (DAR -5.4%) is downgraded to Market Perform at BMO Capital Markets, which believes the near-term stock upside is "somewhat limited," pointing to lagging yellow-grease prices, potentially lower volumes in 2013, and a higher correlation (less of a hedge) between DAR's core business and Diamond Green Diesel.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +6.7%) spike higher as execs presenting at the Liberty Media...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +6.7%) spike higher as execs presenting at the Liberty Media Investor Meeting (webcast) strike a positive tone. Though Nook revenue is pegged at $3B for 2012, the rosy B&N estimate is drawing its share of skeptics with the firm's track record of shooting too high with its guidance a backdrop.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • ESE

    Esco Technologies (ESE -7.8%) cuts its FY 2012 earnings guidance, prompting Needham to cut the...

    Esco Technologies (ESE -7.8%) cuts its FY 2012 earnings guidance, prompting Needham to cut the stock to Hold from Buy. While Needham still views the maker of engineered filtration products as a solid company with a healthy backlog, "the disappointing results and guidance have inherently forced our model lower and added risk to the story."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • WFC

    Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) says it will provide financing for an 11.3 MW solar project being...

    Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) says it will provide financing for an 11.3 MW solar project being developed by MEMC Electronic's (WFR -6.6%) Sun Edison unit in New Mexico, the sixth Sun Edison utility scale solar project funded by WFC in the past year. El Paso Electric (NYSE:EE) agrees to purchase the power supplied by the project for the next 25 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • APKT

    In addition to MetroPCS' about-face on voice-over-LTE (VoLTE), Acme Packet (APKT -2.9%) may have...

    In addition to MetroPCS' about-face on voice-over-LTE (VoLTE), Acme Packet (APKT -2.9%) may have fallen over the last two days thanks to comments from Verizon about its own VoLTE plans. Verizon CTO Nicola Palmer recently claimed the carrier will start VoLTE consumer trials in LTE, and do a full service launch the next year. Though that schedule doesn't differ much from what Raymond James has suggested, Verizon had previously talked about a 2013 launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • NXPI

    NXP (NXPI -5.7%) is slumping on reports a Broadcom (BRCM -0.9%) NFC chip will be used in...

    NXP (NXPI -5.7%) is slumping on reports a Broadcom (BRCM -0.9%) NFC chip will be used in Google's next Android reference design - an NXP chip is used in the current design. Goldman tries to downplay the news, arguing NFC chips make up less than 5% of NXP's sales (ed: but their share is growing quickly). NXP is the early leader in the NFC chip market, and managed to score a design win for Samsung's hit Galaxy S III.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • AA

    Investors should take profits on Alcoa (AA -4.1%) before aluminum prices tank, Nomura advises in...

    Investors should take profits on Alcoa (AA -4.1%) before aluminum prices tank, Nomura advises in lowering its target price on the shares to $9 from $12 "to reflect more conservative forward multiples given continued weakness in aluminum prices and deepening structural challenges as China continues to overproduce and subsidize its domestic industry." (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 11 Comments
  • WSM

    Shares of Williams Sonoma (WSM +2.5%) perk up after William Blair upgrades the retailer to...

    Shares of Williams Sonoma (WSM +2.5%) perk up after William Blair upgrades the retailer to Outperform from a Market Perform rating. Channel checks indicate sales at Pottery Barn were brisk in Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • AKG

    Keegan Resources (KGN +14.7%) reports results of a revised mineral resource estimate for its...

    Keegan Resources (KGN +14.7%) reports results of a revised mineral resource estimate for its Esaase gold project in Ghana: measured and indicated resources of 68.9M metric tons avg. 1.7 grams/metric ton of gold for 3.8M oz., inferred resource of 22.2M metric tons avg. 1.7 grams/metric ton of for 1.25M oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • CENX

    California-based metals producer Century Aluminum (CENX -2.6%) has rejected a proposal meant to...

    California-based metals producer Century Aluminum (CENX -2.6%) has rejected a proposal meant to aid the restarting of its West Virginia smelter, after the electricity rate offer from the state Public Service Commission fell short of its needs. The utility regulator had proposed allowing a special electricity rate for up to 10 years, but the ruling also would've held CENX responsible for making up the difference between that rate and actual power costs. The company says it's reviewing alternatives,

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -5.8%) dives after Bloomberg reports Sprint (S +0.8%) is "holding off on an...

    MetroPCS (PCS -5.8%) dives after Bloomberg reports Sprint (S +0.8%) is "holding off on an immediate counterbid," and wants to look at Deutsche Telekom's regulatory filing for the MetroPCS/T-Mobile deal (expected in a month or two) before making a move. Sprint reportedly offered $8B (including debt) for MetroPCS, which currently has a market cap of $4.3B and $2.4B in net debt, earlier this year. Since then, Sprint's shares have surged, possibly enabling an offer with less equity dilution.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • GRPN

    More on eBay: Reuters reports eBay has quietly launched a local daily deals service in a handful...

    More on eBay: Reuters reports eBay has quietly launched a local daily deals service in a handful of urban areas, in partnership with local online ad firm Signpost. The news has prompted a selloff in Groupon (GRPN -3.6%), which was initially higher following the launch of a restaurant point-of-sale solution that competes with the increasingly popular Square Register. Though Groupon has its share of problems, competition from Internet giants hasn't yet taken a huge toll on its sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • EMR

    Emerson Network Power, a business of Emerson (EMR -1.3%) announces a strategic alliance with...

    Emerson Network Power, a business of Emerson (EMR -1.3%) announces a strategic alliance with regional distributor Mindware in the Middle East and North Africa. Mindware will deliver critical infrastructure products and solutions from Emerson Network Power to small and medium businesses in the region.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SEII

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLNT +28%. TRLG +23%. AUQ +17%. KGN +15%. PBM +14%. OTT +12%. BLIN +19%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: CLNT +28%. TRLG +23%. AUQ +17%. KGN +15%. PBM +14%. OTT +12%. BLIN +19%. KID +12%. VVTV +12%. OTC:ECTE +9%.
    Top 10 Losers: OCZ -40%. ACW -32%. FOE -24%. GLUU -14%. BSET -11%. HELE -10%. BSDM -10%. UPI -10%. AMRN -10%. TZYM -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • AMBA

    After pricing its 6M-share IPO at $6, well below a prior range of $9-$11, Ambarella...

    After pricing its 6M-share IPO at $6, well below a prior range of $9-$11, Ambarella (NASDAQ:AMBA) opened at $6.64 and is currently trading at $6.32, up 5.3%. The gives the developer of image/video-processing chips for cameras and HD broadcast gear a market cap of $163.9M. Ambarella generated revenue of $53.9M (+23% Y/Y) and net income of $7.8M in the 6 months ending July 31. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • END

    Endeavour (END -7.1%) announces a $54M tack-on offering of senior notes; in February, END...

    Endeavour (END -7.1%) announces a $54M tack-on offering of senior notes; in February, END completed a private placement of $350M of 12% first priority notes. Net proceeds will be used to pay down debt and to finance capital costs related to its U.S. and U.K. oil and natural gas properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro's (TSO -4.9%) proposed acquisition of Arco and its Carson refinery for $2.5B faces...

    Tesoro's (TSO -4.9%) proposed acquisition of Arco and its Carson refinery for $2.5B faces increasing opposition, LA Times reports, as activists say the deal would reduce competition and raise prices for motorists. The deal is drawing fire, as California's average gasoline price hits a record $4.671/gal., because it would leave 51% of the state's refining capacity with just TSO and Chevron.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.3%) poke out a gain with the firm's execs slated to speak at...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.3%) poke out a gain with the firm's execs slated to speak at Liberty Media's (LMCA -0.5%) annual investor meeting (webcast) later today. With Liberty Media still holding close to 17% of BKS, a bit of buzz is floating around that something could be unveiled at the affair.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • HELE

    Helen of Troy (HELE -9.6%) slides after its FQ2 earnings missed across the board this morning....

    Helen of Troy (HELE -9.6%) slides after its FQ2 earnings missed across the board this morning. Net income fell 2.6% as the housewares and personal-care products company saw higher acquistion-related taxes which eclipsed a slight improvement in overall revenue. The firm cites an ongoing difficult retail sales environment for the miss, and again lowers its earnings expectations for the fiscal year, now anticipating income of $3.50 to $ 3.60 per share. Revenue estimates remain unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • FB

    A downgrade to Neutral from Piper's Michael Olson has made Zynga among the day's big tech...

    A downgrade to Neutral from Piper's Michael Olson has made Zynga among the day's big tech losers. Olson predicts Zynga's bookings decline will continue "at a steeper pace" into 2013. He also claims a survey of over 7,700 teens confirms "social gaming is as unpopular among teens as we have ever seen" - that's not exactly good news for Facebook (FB -2.3% - previous) either. Glu Mobile's pre-announcement might also be affecting Zynga's shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 4 Comments
  • ACW

    Shares of Accuride (ACW -23%) plunge after the firm warns that class 8 truck orders will...

    Shares of Accuride (ACW -23%) plunge after the firm warns that class 8 truck orders will continue to be weak in the near-term. The company notes that it was notified by Navistar and Paccar that Gunite hub and drum assemblies will no longer be standard equipment on their vehicles.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • HCSG

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG -1.6%) slips on profit-taking following a 15% runup in the stock...

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG -1.6%) slips on profit-taking following a 15% runup in the stock ahead of its Q3 earnings, which largely matched Street estimates late yesterday. Net profit rose 15% on slightly better revenue growth, but investors appear to be concerned that valuations are getting stretched with the stock up nearly 35% YTD. The company also authorized a dividend increase of 0.8% to $0.165 per share from $0.16375.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • FOE

    Ferro (FOE -21.2%) shares are faltering after it again lowered its 2012 earnings guidance,...

    Ferro (FOE -21.2%) shares are faltering after it again lowered its 2012 earnings guidance, mostly owing to a weakening outlook for its business focused on pastes and metal powders used in the production of solar cells. FOE expects to post writedowns of $175M-$200M. At least two research firms - Longbow and First Analysis - downgrade shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -13.1%) is tumbling again today after its Q3 pre-announcement fails to calm...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -13.1%) is tumbling again today after its Q3 pre-announcement fails to calm investors put on edge by a harsh Northland Securities report. Glu's admission that none of its 11 Q3 game launches were "breakout" hits (unlike some older launches) speaks of the intensely competitive environment for iOS and Android games. Zynga (ZNGA -3.1%) knows a thing or two about that as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • OSUR

    OraSure (OSUR +5.3%) pops on news yesterday that the company has launched its OraQuick In-Home...

    OraSure (OSUR +5.3%) pops on news yesterday that the company has launched its OraQuick In-Home HIV test at U.S. retailers nationwide and online. The roll-out marks the first infectious disease test ever to be made available directly to consumers for in-home use. In tandem with the launch, the company is also collaborating with a high profile celebrity as part of an ongoing HIV awareness campaign. Details will be shared via a national media webcast at 3 PM EST today.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.2%) slump with a new note out from OTR Global...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.2%) slump with a new note out from OTR Global warning that the price differential between the company's K-Cup products and those from private labels could be as much as 20% to 50% - viewed by analysts as unsustainable. Another significant drag on GMCR's hopes to dominate the space is the growing emergence of heavyweight Kraft.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 10 Comments
  • QLIK

    Volatile Qlik (QLIK +6%) pops after receiving an upgrade to Buy from UBS. The business...

    Volatile Qlik (QLIK +6%) pops after receiving an upgrade to Buy from UBS. The business intelligence software vendor, which has strong European exposure, fell hard last Thursday following Informatica's warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • LXP

    Lexington Realty Trust (LXP -2.3%) announces a public offering of 15M common shares at...

    Lexington Realty Trust (LXP -2.3%) announces a public offering of 15M common shares at $9.45/share. The REIT expects to use net proceeds to repay debt and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • AVT

    Avnet (AVT -9.6%) tumbles to 52-week lows after warning it expects FQ1 (Sep. quarter) revenue of...

    Avnet (AVT -9.6%) tumbles to 52-week lows after warning it expects FQ1 (Sep. quarter) revenue of $5.85B and EPS of $0.52-$0.58, below a consensus of $6.06B and $0.83. The company blames the impact of delayed IT projects on its hardware distribution ops, and a "pronounced slowdown" in Americas sales for its chip distribution ops. Given Avenet's bellwether status for chip demand, which is already looking shaky, the warning is likely contributing to early weakness in chip stocks (SOXX -0.9%). Rival Arrow (ARW -6.2%) is also selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • CVX

    Chevron (CVX -2.5%) tumbles at the open following yesterday's announcement that its Q3 profit...

    Chevron (CVX -2.5%) tumbles at the open following yesterday's announcement that its Q3 profit will be "substantially lower" than its Q2. UBS cut its Q3 EPS estimate for CVX to $2.83 from $3.22 based on "significant" negative foreign exchange impact, lower-than-expected production, lower liquids realizations and higher corporate expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • NLY

    Mortgage REITs continue to slide - NLY -1%, AGNC -2%, HTS -2.3%, to name 3 - the sector...

    Mortgage REITs continue to slide - NLY -1%, AGNC -2%, HTS -2.3%, to name 3 - the sector revaluing itself for what must surely be significant dividend cuts. The Fed's MBS purchases - likely to help book values and dividend maintenance in the short run - are vaporizing net interest margins. Absent a big jump in leverage, returns must fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 58 Comments
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) -6.8% after saying that doesn't expect a decision from the FDA this month...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) -6.8% after saying that doesn't expect a decision from the FDA this month on whether to grant the company's request for five-year marketing exclusivity for its Vascepa heart pill, which the agency approved in July. Amarin doesn't haven't a clue whether the FDA will grant its request or when it will make a decision.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 3 Comments
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (NASDAQ:PCYC) +3.7% premarket after signing an agreement with Novo Nordisk...

    Pharmacyclics (NASDAQ:PCYC) +3.7% premarket after signing an agreement with Novo Nordisk (NYSE:NVO) that gives the Danish insulin producer rights to certain uses of its Factor VIIa molecule inhibitor. PCYC expects to receive $5M up front, as much as $55M in milestone payments, plus royalties on sales of NVO products that use the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa's (NYSE:AA) earnings report, greeted initially by at least moderate enthusiasm, raises...

    Alcoa's (NYSE:AA) earnings report, greeted initially by at least moderate enthusiasm, raises some warning signs after the company cut expectations for growth in aluminum consumption in 2012, even as it reaffirmed its outlook for a doubling of aluminum demand between 2010 and 2020. AA -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • STEC

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC) -5.2% in response to OCZ's (NASDAQ:OCZ) warning, which includes a forecast...

    STEC (NASDAQ:STEC) -5.2% in response to OCZ's (NASDAQ:OCZ) warning, which includes a forecast the solid-state drive maker will report a "negative gross margins and a significant net loss" for FQ2 (August quarter) - the consensus was for a $0.15/share loss. OCZ, which originally planned to report earnings today, is hosting a CC at 10AM ET to discuss its CEO change and problems (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures struggle for direction as earnings seasons gets underway with...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures struggle for direction as earnings seasons gets underway with Alcoa's (-1.1%) mixed results late yesterday. The S&P benchmark is flat while Nasdaq futures are +0.1%. Yum Brands is +4.6% following rather tasty results and FedExpress is +3.1% as it reveals a $1.7B "profitability improvement" plan. Later: Wholesale Trade, Fed's Beige Book, Fed Speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • TRLG

    Premarket gainers: TRLG +24%. AUQ +10%. TISA +7%. Losers: OCZ -41%. FOE -17%. AVT -11%. GLUU -7%.

    Premarket gainers: TRLG +24%. AUQ +10%. TISA +7%.
    Losers: OCZ -41%. FOE -17%. AVT -11%. GLUU -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • TM

    Shares of Toyota (NYSE:TM) fall 1.3% premarket after the company issues a recall for over 7M...

    Shares of Toyota (NYSE:TM) fall 1.3% premarket after the company issues a recall for over 7M vehicles. Though the raw number of automobiles affected is high, with no injuries or deaths attributed to the faulty power window switch the issue isn't viewed as one the automaker can't climb out of rather quickly.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • HRB

    H & R Block (NYSE:HRB) considers "strategic alternatives" for its banking unit and...

    H&R Block (NYSE:HRB) considers "strategic alternatives" for its banking unit and has hired Goldman Sachs to advise. A sale of H & R Block Bank would, of course, free the company from being regulated by the Federal Reserve and tough new capital requirements. Shares -4.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • OCZ

    Shares of OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) fall 42% in premarket trading after the company issues a...

    Shares of OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) fall 42% in premarket trading after the company issues a stark warning on Q2 revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • AUQ

    AuRico Gold (NYSE:AUQ) +10.9% premarket after agreeing to sell its troubled Ocampo mine in...

    AuRico Gold (NYSE:AUQ) +10.9% premarket after agreeing to sell its troubled Ocampo mine in Mexico and other properties to Carlos Slim's Minera Frisco for $750M. Canaccord upgrades shares to Buy from Hold, saying the deal will improve AUQ's balance sheet: "The sale should reduce volatility and increase predictability of quarterly results - more desirable from a capital markets standpoint."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • FDX

    Federal Express (NYSE:FDX) +3.1% premarket following its $1.7B "profitability improvement" plan....

    Federal Express (NYSE:FDX) +3.1% premarket following its $1.7B "profitability improvement" plan. The sell side reacts: The magnitude of the savings figure suggests that the stock will go higher on the news, says CSFB. The plan is well above the $400-500M expected by JPMorgan, which sees a positive response from the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT) +18% premarket after receiving $2.2M in purchase orders for its...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT) +18% premarket after receiving $2.2M in purchase orders for its airflow dyeing machines and related components from new and existing domestic customers. The machines use air flow rather than water in the dyeing process, which CLNT believes results in reduced input costs, fewer wrinkles and reduced emissions.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • GEVO

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) +3.9% premarket after receiving a U.S. patent for its platform-separation...

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) +3.9% premarket after receiving a U.S. patent for its platform-separation unit which lowers the cost of producing isobutanol. The patent provides Gevo with a "significant competitive advantage, as it protects the most cost-efficient separation technology available," the company says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • CMI

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) -3.7% premarket following its sales warning last night. Deja vu all over...

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) -3.7% premarket following its sales warning last night. Deja vu all over again, this warning is nearly identical to the one given 3 months ago to the day. Shares cratered then, but were quickly back on the rise and soared the day (July 31) of the earnings release. Will history continue to repeat (earnings set for Oct. 30)?

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM | 9 Comments
